titleStmt.title: Letter from Martha to Eartha M. M. White. July 21, 1933.
titleStmt.author: Martha

publicationStmt.p: This document forms part of the project "Editing the Earth M.M. White Collection" at the University of North Florida.

msIdentifier.repository: University of North Florida, Thomas G. Carpenter Library Special Collections and Archives

msContents.summary: Author writes to White discussing the recent deaths of residents of the Old Folks' Home..

objectDesc.p: A handwritten letter of two pages from Marthe to White, written in 7/21/1933. It discusses the deaths of residents of the Old Folks' Home.

editorialDecl.p: This file was transcribed and encoded according to the editorial criteria of the project "Editing the Eartha M.M. White Collection." Using the various options encoded within <choice> elements, this file enables the viewing of a diplomatic transcription and a regularized reading text.

body.p:
Your cards was all recieved
and found us all well and getting along
fine. I am glad you are well and happy.

I am delighted to herehear that you are having
a nice time. Only wish I was with you.
Martha is improving nicely. She is able to sit.

Every thingEverything is progressing nicely at the
Mission and the Old Folks Home.

Mr. Stephen Williams died the same morning you left.
weWe had a very nice funeral for him on Thursday July 13, casket was
covered with flowers. A Rev.Reverend Ross of Sweetfield
Baptist Church preached a very nice funeral. This
is the way it was carried out. Singing How happy
are the Saints, prayer by Rev.Reverend Ross, singing Asleep
in JeasusJesus, Resolution from Old Folks Home by
M.F. Green, quartet Old Ragged Cross by 1 girl
and three boys that work around the home.) The
obituary, singing thanthen Sermonsermon, singing Nearer
my God to thee. Pratt furnished 1 car and a friend
of Mrs. Gaskins another bar it rained all afternoon.

Well Mr. Joe H. James sent Mr. Chas Erins out
to the Old Folks Home and he is as happy as a
child. Mr. James said he would look after his order.

Mr. Thomas is progressing nicely with his work.
If he had the material he would have been futherfurther
advanced., but we hope to surprise you, on your
return.

Recieved a letter from James Kenley, he is at Veterans
Administration Home Virginia, Company C. I answered
his letter for you.

Lots of deaths lately, John J. Christper died
last week. I am enclosing a list of deaths also a clipingclipping
about your friend.

Eartha, I am going to Tampa Saturday night.
I keep dreaming about Albert, I wrote him twice
& recieved no answer. Will return Monday morning.

We had the hearestharshest downpour of rain of the season
yesterday.

My family & friends join in love, and best
wishes. to you & friends.
